name: European Climate Foundation
goal: The European Climate Foundation (ECF) was established in early 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to build evidence, public understanding and activities which support climate, energy and other policies that greatly reduce Europeâ€™s greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and to help Europe play an even stronger international leadership role to mitigate climate change.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Energy, Research and innovation, Single market, Transport
euInitiatives:
- A Framework Strategy for a Resilient Energy Union with a Forward-Looking Climate Change Policy, including;
- Clean Energy for All Europeans
- Regulation on the governance of the Energy Union
- Accelerating Clean Energy Innovation
- Internal energy market design
- Energy Efficiency, notably the Energy Efficiency Directive, Ecodesign and Energy Labelling Directive and Energy Performance of Buildings Directive
- Climate Action, including the Emissions Trading System Directive and Effort-Sharing Decision, international climate negotiations, and Mid-Century Strategy
- Research and Innovation
- Regulation to define the modalities for reaching the 2020 target to reduce CO 2 emissions from new passenger cars
- Industrial Policy Strategy
- Circular Economy, including Plastics Strategy
